title: Threshold Of Fate
opening: The Silessian civil war is over, and the Grannvale army awaits Sigurd. Zaxon Castle has barely fallen, yet before Sigurd can so much as rest, the hordes of Grannvale stand before him at the captured Lubeck Castle.
The Grannvale commander, Duke Langbalt, is a longtime enemy of Sigurd's father. For Sigurd, to challenge Langbalt is an opportunity to avenge his father, Byron, framed by Langbalt for his crimes.

Beyond Lubeck, in the desert town Phinora, Lord Arvis's elite warriors stand guard under the command of the war-mage Vaha. Velthomer Castle, on Grannvale's border with the Aed Desert, is defended by Lord Arvis' trusted aide, General Aida. And in Belhalla, the royal capital of Grannvale, Lord Arvis serves to aid the bedridden King Azmur, while Chancellor Reptor of Friege maintains peace and order in the city.

A long road to Belhalla awaits Sigurd... A clash with Grannvale en route is inevitable. Sigurd refuses to endanger the people of Silesse any further in this conflict. He is determined to fight to the end.
The year is Grann 760, early spring. The fields of Silesse peacefully rest beneath a deep blanket of snow…

intro.speaker: Byron
intro.line: Nngh... Sigurd... ...No, I mustn't die yet... No... Not until the exalted blade is in your hands…

intro.speaker: Slayder
intro.line: Milord, we've sighted the fugitive Duke Byron. We caught him resting, but he slipped away. It seems as if he plans to escape to Silesse.

intro.speaker: Langbalt
intro.line: What?! You simpleton! Get out there and hunt him down, immediately! My ambush may have put an end to Chalphy's paladin brigade, the Grünritter, but the survival of Byron alone leaves that utterly meaningless!

intro.speaker: Slayder
intro.line: Y-yes, sir... But you see, milord, Byron is still gravely wounded. Surely, he has very little time left...

intro.speaker: Langbalt
intro.line: I've never heard such naïve drivel! Byron may not be long for this world, but he's determined to get that sword, Tyrfing, to his son with the very last of his strength. Do you not understand the threat that Sigurd would pose to us, should he get his hands on that damnable sword? Move out and kill Byron, immediately!

intro.speaker: Langbalt
intro.line: For that matter, where in blazes is Danan with those reinforcements?! For the gods' sake, he's leading the elite Grau Ritter brigade! How could it take him so long to put down that Isaachian resistance?! First Lex, and now Danan... Why must both of my sons be so worthless?!

intro.speaker: André
intro.line: Come now, Lord Langbalt, sir! Don't worry about a thing. After all, you've still got the Beige Ritter and I on your side.

intro.speaker: Langbalt
intro.line: I suppose you're right, André. Be sure that your men are ready to join the fray at a moment's notice.

intro.speaker: André
intro.line: Heh. It would be my pleasure, sir…

intro.speaker: Langbalt
intro.line: Damn that insolent worm. To think he isn't even the slightest bit remorseful for slaying his own father! Duke Ring... May you be at peace…

intro.speaker: Oifey
intro.line: Sire! We've sighted a lone knight to our east, who appears to be headed our way.

intro.speaker: Oifey
intro.line: I don't believe so. The Lubeck occupation seems to be pursuing him, so they're most likely not with them.

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: I see. Let's give them a hand. We'll be clashing with Langbalt's army sooner or later, so why not make the first move? Move out! Our target is their front lines. Today's victory hinges on this first strike!

battle.speaker: Byron
battle.line: N-no… No! SIGURD! And to think, I was so close… O gods… Why… Why have you forsaken me…

battle.speaker: Oifey
battle.line: That was quite the fierce bout, sire.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Mm. And to think, none of them were Grannvale's elite! Listen, Oifey, I need to ask something of you.

battle.speaker: Oifey
battle.line: Of course, sire. What is it?

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: As I recall, the territory of Isaach should be very close to the north-east of Lubeck. From what I've heard, ever since Grannvale won the war, Isaach has been governed by Dannan, Langbalt's eldest son. But I'd wager his influence has yet to reach much of the country's span, so...

battle.speaker: Oifey
battle.line: I beg your pardon, sire?! Are you seriously asking me to abandon you for safety, now of all times? No! I refuse! I will not leave you, sire! I'm here for you no matter what, till I draw my last breath!

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Oifey, listen... I know this is a huge imposition, but please. Just hear me out. I... I don't want to lose Seliph. He isn't even two years old yet! I can hardly fight with an infant in tow. Please, Oifey. Take care of Seliph. Take him and find refuge from this blasted war. I know I can trust you, Oifey. You are my only hope.

battle.speaker: Oifey
battle.line: Sire... I... Very well. I'll take Lord Seliph. I'll protect him, no matter what happens. That said, you have to promise me. Promise me that you'll come for us as soon as this war is over. I won't leave you if you can't promise that.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Of course. I swear I'll come for the two of you.

battle.speaker: Oifey
battle.line: Thank you...

battle.speaker: Shannan
battle.line: Hold it! I promised Deirdre that I'll look after Seliph no matter what! I won't hand him over to anyone, not even Oifey, until Deirdre says I can!

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Calm down, Shannan... I know you're still hurt about losing Deirdre, but this isn't helping. It's okay. He'll be fine with Oifey.

battle.speaker: Shannan
battle.line: No! I need to protect Seliph! And you're forgetting that the people of Isaach won't exactly be happy to see more Grannvaleans! Oifey alone won't last a minute there, but if I'm there it'll be okay. Who better to protect Seliph in Isaach than the prince of Isaach? Please... I promised her...

battle.speaker: Oifey
battle.line: Now that he mentions it, sire, I would be a tad more at ease if Shannan was there as well. I know you're reluctant to involve one as young as Shannan in something so dangerous. But I think we can agree he's become a talented warrior. Not to mention, I'll need Shannan to secure the people's support.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Hm... I'm sorry to burden you more, Shannan, but please... Take care of Seliph for me.

battle.speaker: Shannan
battle.line: Okay! Leave it to me! I'm gonna keep getting stronger, and nobody'll ever hurt Seliph! I'll teach him all about Deirdre, but... I wonder how he'll take what happened...

battle.speaker: Oifey
battle.line: I suppose we should get going, then. Farewell, sire. Take care of yourself. I pray victory and clemency find you as soon possible.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Thank you, Oifey. Be careful out there.

battle.speaker: Oifey
battle.line: Yes, sir!

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Seliph... I'm so sorry. Please, grow up safe and strong…

battle.speaker: Quan
battle.line: Gentlemen, we've not much further to go. Keep giving it your best. Rumor has it that Sigurd's army should be moving south through the Yied Desert. If we keep this pace north, we should be able to rendezvous with them sooner or later.

battle.speaker: Ethlyn
battle.line: Quan, I'm so sorry I dragged you into this. You and your father were too generous sparing so many soldiers to help my brother, even though your father is presently so ill... But are you sure you're both willing to risk crossing a nation as all-powerful as Grannvale? The very thought is terrifying...

battle.speaker: Quan
battle.line: Ethlyn, you know as well as I that Leonster, a nation built on the legacy of the Crusader Nova, is far stronger than its size suggests. No matter what happens, I could never regret giving my all for a cause as just as Sigurd's. My father feels precisely the same way. There's nothing to worry about, Ethlyn. After all, I'm wielding none other than Gáe Bolg! I'll never fail with it at my side! Sigurd could certainly stand to have my aid.

battle.speaker: Ethlyn
battle.line: I suppose you're right. He'd appreciate any help at this point...

battle.speaker: Quan
battle.line: Ethlyn, we'll be entering hostile territory very shortly. The enemy could ambush us at any moment, so...

battle.speaker: Ethlyn
battle.line: Actually, Quan... I've been thinking this over quite a bit, and I'm coming with you after all. I'd like to see my brother again, and I simply can't abandon you now.

battle.speaker: Quan
battle.line: I can't allow that! I let you come with me solely because you promised to return home partway. To say nothing of Altena's presence! Look at her, a mere babe of three years curled up aslumber in her mother's lap. Should we be attacked, what then?

battle.speaker: Ethlyn
battle.line: Why, I'd fight my hardest to protect her. Nobody could possibly seize her from me! I certainly never intended at first to take her with us. But she simply wouldn't stop crying when I tried to leave her behind. You're right, though... You're right. I'll take her home.

battle.speaker: Quan
battle.line: Ethlyn, I'm sorry. I assure you I do know precisely how you feel, but Leif is barely born and waiting for you at home. Our children need their mother. Please, Ethlyn. Return home. I left Finn to defend the capital. You'll be safe with him.

battle.speaker: Ethlyn
battle.line: Very well, but... I'd like just a little more time. I want to stay by your side a little longer. Please, Quan...

battle.speaker: Quan
battle.line: Ethlyn... Very well. We've a little more time to spare.

battle.speaker: Travant
battle.line: Hehehe... Ah, Quan! The poor sod still has no clue we're tailing him. And there's a woman with him? What a clumsy mistake. Why, I daresay this is the long-awaited end of Leonster's famous Lanceritter! Those hooves'll be sinking clean into the sand. They can't so much as flail at us. Men, close in! This is it! Thracia's destiny lies before us, ripe for the grasping!

battle.speaker: Quan
battle.line: What? Thracian wyvern knights?! No... You cannot be serious! Travant has been at our heels all along! Ethlyn, run! We've no hope of victory in this blasted desert!

battle.speaker: Ethlyn
battle.line: But... What will you do?

battle.speaker: Quan
battle.line: They're like wild hyenas, Ethlyn! Children are little more than easy targets for them! Thracia has sought to reconquer our territory for centuries. I thought my absence would be taken as an invitation, so I left Finn behind with half the army in case they made the obvious move. Not once... Not even once did I ever suspect they would pursue US instead! I... This was all a mistake...

battle.speaker: Ethlyn
battle.line: You can't give up now, Quan! It'll be okay. We're together, aren't we? At the very least, together we'll not go down easily!

battle.speaker: Quan
battle.line: Ethlyn... Forgive me, please…

battle.speaker: Arvis
battle.line: I see. Duke Langbalt fell in battle…

battle.speaker: Reptor
battle.line: A-Arvis! What are we supposed to do now?! It was you who insisted that, even if we left the bulk of our armies on conquests with our sons, Sigurd would pose no threat to me at all! The situation before us is not the outcome you promised me!

battle.speaker: Arvis
battle.line: Reptor, your overreaction is baseless. The deck is still stacked in our favor. The Velthomer army is already lying in wait for the rebels in the Yied Desert's depths. Furthermore, Thracian sellswords should be arriving to reinforce us at any moment. The enemy will assuredly be exhausted. So long as my army and yours cooperate, Sigurd and his rebels ought to fall with ease.

battle.speaker: Reptor
battle.line: I'm holding you to your word this time, Arvis. Remember, I've no objection to you alone claiming the throne once Azmur finally dies. But don't you dare forget your allies…

battle.speaker: Arvis
battle.line: Of course. Must I remind you? The instant the dust of this war settles, House Friege will be granted the Agustrian throne to govern. House Dozel, meanwhile, will be entrusted with the rule of Isaach. Rest assured, Reptor. I will honor your rights to these territories.

battle.speaker: Reptor
battle.line: Hrm... Very well. Then I, too, will fight with all I have…

battle.speaker: Manfroy
battle.line: Kehehehehe... Greetings, Lord Arvis. The plan proceeds precisely on time, I see…

battle.speaker: Arvis
battle.line: Manfroy... If I've told you once, I've told you a thousand times... You must not show your face here. Until the Grannvale throne is mine, I cannot allow you or your brethren to appear in public. Do you not understand?

battle.speaker: Manfroy
battle.line: Oh, we understand. We understand how you indulge the greed of men as vile as Reptor and Langbalt. We understand how even then, you still will not concede the very fact of our existence. The plan was to use those two buffoons until they could be used no further, then cast them aside and use their sons in their stead... Was it not?

battle.speaker: Arvis
battle.line: Mm, but... Hear me well, Manfroy. I refuse to have any part in the revival of your Loptyr Empire. I've no desire to oppress your cult, but I've even less of a desire to consign the world to your dark lord's rule. Remember this well. Yes, the blood of Loptyr's scions flows in my veins, but there is so much more to me than that. My Loptyrian heritage is that of Saint Maira, a man who fought for the rights of the people. And more importantly, I am the one true heir to the Crusader Vala, Loptyr's sworn enemy. I will change this world for the better. Under my rule, humanity shall be free from the pain of prejudice, tyranny and oppression! What a pity it is, that Sigurd must die, but alas, all things require sacrifice.

battle.speaker: Manfroy
battle.line: Ohohoho... A sacrifice for the sake of the Lady Deirdre, you mean. You are terrified, Lord Arvis. You fear her memory may someday return…

battle.speaker: Arvis
battle.line: Don't you dare bring her into this! Need I remind you? We. Are. In. LOVE! Nothing will ever come between us!

battle.speaker: Manfroy
battle.line: Heh heh heh... I suppose you two need to hasten and make proof of this love of yours. Proof that will one day grow up and rise to be a most magnificent king! Heh heh heh…

battle.speaker: Vaha
battle.line: The rebels are finally headed this way? Heh, excellent. Let them walk right into the range of my welcoming gift: Meteor spells! The desert will gladly claim their bodies!

battle.speaker: Travant
battle.line: What's this? The woman was fool enough to have a child with her? Ah, I see... Quan's daughter. Interesting... You there! Tell Quan this: If he doesn't surrender Gáe Bolg, his daughter will meet an untimely end. Heh heh heh... Your move, Quan. Your move.

battle.speaker: Quan
battle.line: N-no! Altena... Ethlyn... So this is where it ends... Travant! You can have Gáe Bolg, but don't you DARE so much as scratch Altena!

battle.speaker: Travant
battle.line: And so ends Quan... Magorn! You're in charge now. Head north and give Sigurd's army a fair share of grief. Let none of them escape. There's a fine bounty on each traitorous head, after all.

battle.speaker: Magorn
battle.line: Yes, Sir! Er, that said, what are we supposed to do with this child? She's just crying and crying. We don't know how to handle this. Shall I put her out of her misery, sir?

battle.speaker: Travant
battle.line: Certainly not. Hand her over to me. She and Gáe Bolg are coming with me back to Thracia.

battle.speaker: Magorn
battle.line: Can't say I expected this, sir. If I may, why exactly are you taking her home with you?

battle.speaker: Travant
battle.line: Moron! You've no need to know! Keep that mouth of yours out of business that isn't yours.

battle.speaker: Magorn
battle.line: Y-yes, sir. I beg your forgiveness, sir. By your leave, sir, we will pursue Sigurd's rebels.

battle.speaker: Travant
battle.line: Good. Don't fail me.

battle.speaker: Travant
battle.line: What’s this? The woman was fool enough to have a child with her? Ah, I see… Quan’s daughter. Interesting. Hand her over to me. Hand her over to me. She and Gáe Bolg are coming with me back to Thracia.

battle.speaker: Magorn
battle.line: Can't say I expected this, sir. If I may, why exactly are you taking her home with you?

battle.speaker: Travant
battle.line: Moron! You've no need to know! Keep that mouth of yours out of business that isn't yours.

battle.speaker: Magorn
battle.line: Y-yes, sir. I beg your forgiveness, sir. By your leave, sir, we will pursue Sigurd's rebels.

battle.speaker: Travant
battle.line: Good. Don't fail me.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Good. We've finally claimed Phinora. The fatherland is finally within our reach. Oifey and Shannan... I pray they and Seliph are faring well...

battle.speaker: Old Man
battle.line: Lord Sigurd, I presume? Welcome to Phinora.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Ah, you must be the local elder. My apologies for dragging even an oasis town like Phinora into this godforsaken war.

battle.speaker: Old Man
battle.line: Mm, at this point it was unavoidable. Actually, we've just received word of yet another skirmish in the desert's southern depths. Alas, we find ourselves in dangerous times...

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: In the south, you say... What happened there?

battle.speaker: Old Man
battle.line: As we understand it, the lance knights of Leonster were on a march north. They were savaged by Thracian wyvern knights en route. There were no survivors, it seems.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: W-what?! You can't be serious!

battle.speaker: Old Man
battle.line: I'm sorry to say I am. By the sound of it, there was a young girl in the Leonster party. Our hearts all break for the poor dear...

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: That's... that was Ethlyn and Quan... Forgive... forgive me…

battle.speaker: Travant
battle.line: And so ends Quan... Magorn! You're in charge now. Head north and give Sigurd's army a fair share of grief. Let none of them escape. There's a fine bounty on each traitorous head, after all.

battle.speaker: Magorn
battle.line: Yes, Sir! Er, that said, what are we supposed to do with this child? She's just crying and crying. We don't know how to handle this. Shall I put her out of her misery, sir?

battle.speaker: Travant
battle.line: Certainly not. Hand her over to me. She and Gáe Bolg are coming with me back to Thracia.

battle.speaker: Magorn
battle.line: Can't say I expected this, sir. If I may, why exactly are you taking her home with you?

battle.speaker: Travant
battle.line: Moron! You've no need to know! Keep that mouth of yours out of business that isn't yours.

battle.speaker: Magorn
battle.line: Y-yes, sir. I beg your forgiveness, sir. By your leave, sir, we will pursue Sigurd's rebels.

battle.speaker: Travant
battle.line: Good. Don't fail me.

battle.speaker: Aida
battle.line: Lord Reptor, we’re depending upon you.

battle.speaker: Reptor
battle.line: Of course. Even so… I cannot help but wonder if Arvis will honor his word. Perhaps… Perhaps we are nothing more but sacrifices to him.

battle.speaker: Aida
battle.line: Lord Arvis is hard at working making the final adjustments to his Velthomer battle plan. You’ve no need to worry, sire.

battle.speaker: Reptor
battle.line: Very well. I’ll take you at your word, then.

battle.speaker: Aida
battle.line: Now, if you’ll excuse me, sire, I must return to the helm of the Velthomer barricades.

battle.speaker: Aida
battle.line: Heh... He hasn't a clue, has he? Wretched fool…

battle.speaker: Reptor
battle.line: This is it. Until Arvis is ready to move out, this battle is ours and ours alone. Hold to your positions until the enemy stumbles into our range. Do not move otherwise!

battle.speaker: Reptor
battle.line: This is it. The time to strike is upon us! With the fire mages of Velthomer at our side, we shall crush the rebels in one fell swoop!

battle.speaker: Aida
battle.line: Execute the plan. Concentrate all of your fire on Reptor and his army. There will be no survivors under any circumstance. Am I clear?

battle.speaker: Reptor
battle.line: W-what? Velthomer has turned on us?! Argh... So this is what Arvis planned all along…

end.speaker: Aida
end.line: Ah, Lord Sigurd. I'm glad to see you're safe.

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: What's going on? What's caused Velthomer's change of loyalties?

end.speaker: Aida
end.line: Lord Arvis has long been aware of your innocence, and was on your side all along. This affair in its entirety was dictated by the whims of Reptor and Langbalt, architects of the conspiracy against you. Lord Arvis was unable to act until now, as the dukes' control of the royal court was simply too powerful to contravene.

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: Is that so... All's well that ends well, then. I can restore my father's good name in the court, and that'll be the end of it.

end.speaker: Aida
end.line: Indeed. Lord Arvis and His Majesty await your return in Belhalla, Lord Sigurd. Please, make your way to the royal city as soon as possible.

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: Really? Very well. I'll be going, then.

end.speaker: Aida
end.line: I hear that Lord Arvis arranged a ceremonial reception for you with the entirety of the Belhalla royal guard. Quite the magnificent celebration of your glorious return is in order today, it seems.

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: Thank you. After all that's happened the past few years, this ought to be a fitting conclusion. Once we're done I should look into getting my allies some compensation for their help. They certainly deserve it after all this!

cutscene.speaker: Arvis
cutscene.line: Ah, Lord Sigurd. Truly this is quite the auspicious day. Congratulations on your triumphant return to the fatherland!

cutscene.speaker: Sigurd
cutscene.line: It's good to see you too, Lord Arvis, and thank you for such a lavish greeting! If I may ask, where is His Majesty?

cutscene.speaker: Arvis
cutscene.line: Alas, His Majesty is taken severely ill. He has become permanently bedridden. As such, I am administering all affairs of state on his behalf for the time being.

cutscene.speaker: Sigurd
cutscene.line: Is that so? I'm sorry to hear that. I bet my misadventures didn't help His Majesty feel any better! Once we're finished here, I should visit the palace and give him my sincerest apologies.

cutscene.speaker: Arvis
cutscene.line: ...I think not.

cutscene.speaker: Sigurd
cutscene.line: Hm?

cutscene.speaker: Arvis
cutscene.line: Sigurd of Chalphy, I hereby sentence you to death for your crimes of treason. His Majesty will not be seeing you, today or ever.

cutscene.speaker: Sigurd
cutscene.line: W-what?! What are you talking about, Lord Arvis?!

cutscene.speaker: Arvis
cutscene.line: Heh... You are only realizing now? You are far too naïve, Sigurd. Need I remind you that you and your father still sought to usurp the throne and plotted against the crown? Nothing has changed. It is my duty to exact justice upon you, in the name of my wife, Princess Deirdre. I trust you understand, Sigurd.

cutscene.speaker: Sigurd
cutscene.line: P-Princess Deirdre?! That... No, it can't be...

cutscene.speaker: Arvis
cutscene.line: Ah, of course. You've never met, correct? Very well. I suppose an introduction would be a fair parting gift before your demise. Come, Deirdre! Greet our guests!

cutscene.speaker: Arvis
cutscene.line: Deirdre, allow me to introduce you to Sigurd: the spawn of your father's murderer, Byron. I trust you have some choice words for him?

cutscene.speaker: Deirdre
cutscene.line: So... So this is... Sir Sigurd?

cutscene.speaker: Sigurd
cutscene.line: Deirdre?! No... This can't be happening...

cutscene.speaker: Deirdre
cutscene.line: Why... Why are you speaking like this...?

cutscene.speaker: Sigurd
cutscene.line: Deirdre! It really is you! No... No, no, no...

cutscene.speaker: Deirdre
cutscene.line: Do... Do you know me, sir?

cutscene.speaker: Sigurd
cutscene.line: OF COURSE I DO! YOU'RE MY-

cutscene.speaker: Arvis
cutscene.line: Enough! Deirdre, stand clear. This is an extremely dangerous man. Rest assured: this traitor will be punished.

cutscene.speaker: Deirdre
cutscene.line: But... He... He's... Can't we have even a little more time?

cutscene.speaker: Arvis
cutscene.line: Unacceptable. Guards! Escort the princess to the castle!

cutscene.speaker: Deirdre
cutscene.line: Wait! Arvis, please! ...Just a little more time…

cutscene.speaker: Sigurd
cutscene.line: W-wait! DEIRDRE! Arvis, please! I beg of you! She... She's my...

cutscene.speaker: Arvis
cutscene.line: Enough! I grow weary of your ravings. Attention, men! We no longer have any use for keeping the traitors alive. Move in on Sigurd and his party! The time to serve them their punishment has come!

cutscene.speaker: Sigurd
cutscene.line: ...D... DAMN YOU, ARVIS!!

narration: And thus comes the end of an era.

The path of Grannvale's great unrest, arising from the conflict with Isaach, has led one young man to his grim fate. His sorrowful tale, and those of countless other valiants, are not lost to the world.
Many heroes lost their lives on this path...
And Sigurd, the young heir of Chalphy...
And the names of those heroes who fought alongside Sigurd to the bitter end at Belhalla, whose fates remain unknown...
These brave youths fought to change the world for the better, yet now their unfulfilled dreams lie dead with them on the battlefield...
Was their sacrifice in vain? What were they fighting for all along?

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Heard the news? Grannvale's army just swept in and seized Lubeck Castle! Oh... I fear for Silesse's future…

visit.speaker: Young Man
visit.line: To think, Silesse remained such a peaceful place for generations and generations! Argh, how did this world turn into such a savage place…

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: It seems that strengths and abilities are passed down from parents to children. You'll often find that boys'll take up their father's traits more dominantly, while girls'll be more strongly influenced by their mother's.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: That Langbalt's got his thugs going around and clearing out every village they can find! Good thing we somehow kept a little bit of gold hidden away from those brutes! Go on, take it. We know you need it more than us.

visit.speaker: Young Woman
visit.line: Did ya know? The famous Lord Eldigan of Nordion and his wife had themselves a little son before he died a while back. His name's, er... Ares? Something like that. I feel pretty bad for the poor boy... He's gotta be just three or four years old…

visit.speaker: Young Man
visit.line: 'S been a while since Grannvale beat Isaach in the war, but they're strugglin' to put down resistance out in its farthest corners. But the people of Isaach ain't givin' up hope. Prince Shannan's still out there, an' they know someday he'll lead 'em to freedom!

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: It's terrifying just how far Grannvale has fallen from the peaceful nation it used to be! All they ever do these days is set their army on every country they can get their hands on. Prince Kurth'd be utterly ashamed to know what's become of his beloved Grannvale... You have to do something! I'm begging you... Go to Grannvale! Take the country back from the wicked folk who are perverting all it holds dear!

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: It can't be... F-Father?! Thank the gods! You're alive!

battle-talk.speaker: Byron
battle-talk.line: Sigurd... What a splendid young man you've become... Cough! C-cough...

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Father! Come on, you mustn't give in now!

battle-talk.speaker: Byron
battle-talk.line: No... There's no hope left for me now... Listen well, my son. Langbalt was Prince Kurth's true killer. And Reptor is the one holding his leash... His Majesty must know the truth! I... Death holds no fear for me. But I cannot die in peace not knowing if our honor shall be cleansed of these lies.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: It's just as I thought all along... Rest assured, Father. Our good name will be cleared. I promise.

battle-talk.speaker: Byron
battle-talk.line: Sigurd, I... I beg your forgiveness... 'Tis my negligence which condemned you to these torments... Sigurd... Take this. It is Tyrfing... Our exalted blade...

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Tyrfing... But, Father! Surely you'll still need this...

battle-talk.speaker: Byron
battle-talk.line: Take it, Sigurd. Use it to... restore our... honor...

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: F-Father! Hold on... Please! Father...

battle-talk.speaker: Oifey
battle-talk.line: Sire...

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Why... Why in the world did he have to... Gah... Reptor! Langbalt! Mark my words! You will pay dearly for all you've done!

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Is something wrong, Brigid?

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Oh, Aideen. You heard about what André's been up to lately, right?

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: I did. I've heard of how he murdered our father, and later Mahnya died in Silesse as well... I can barely imagine the evil which would have possessed him to do such monstrous things.

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: ...I'm going to kill André. There's no other way. Whatever the evil is, he has to be stopped. Right here, right now. You get what I'm saying, right, Aideen?

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Brigid...

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: André's crimes are House Jungby's crimes. They're our crimes, too. They reflect badly on us, even though they really shouldn't. I know I'll have his blood on my hands for the rest of my life, but... Aideen, I want you to understand.

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Of course I do, Brigid…

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: This is the end, Aideen. Our final battle.

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Indeed.

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: I have a little gift for you. Here. Use this to aid our young comrades.

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: This is a Rescue staff, is it not? Thank you, but… why me?

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: Well… I’ve yet to speak a word of this to anyone, but as my wife… You should know. Listen well, Aideen. We cannot prevail. This war today will end with our defeat. Everything we hold dear will be lost.

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: ...I beg your pardon?!

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: Such is the decree of the gods that I received at the Tower of Bragi. I, too, struggled to accept it at first. However, this is our fate. It is inevitable. I know I am destined to die in this battle. Thus, I entrust you with this staff.

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: That… You must be lying! I cannot believe any of it! I cannot! Please… Please! Tell me this is just a cruel joke…

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: Aideen, there is no need to grieve. Our deaths are not the end, but rather a new beginning for us all. Life is fated to fade into death, and with it, so too does mortal form die. And yet, never shall life fade into total nothingness. Death is but the herald for the next step to a perfect state of being. It holds no fear for mankind.

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: But… But, Claude…

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: Even as I greet death, a rebirth awaits… Why, look no further than yourself for proof! Within you grows a new life waiting to be born, and I too am a part of it. This, Aideen, is why you must live on.

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Do… Do you realize what you’re saying, Claude?! Asking me to live on while I accept your death… It isn’t fair…

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: Aideen…  I am richly blessed to have known you and been your husband, even so briefly. Please, forgive me…

battle-talk.speaker: Aideen
battle-talk.line: Claude….

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Hold on... Ayra?! Why are you still here? Didn't I task you with accompanying Shannan and Oifey to Isaach?

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: You did, but I feel I'd always regret abandoning your army at such a crucial hour. I'm with you until the end, Sigurd.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: I don't believe this... If you're not going, how are you supposed to protect Shannan?

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: Ah, of course. My pledge to my late brother... Shannan has grown into a strong young man, capable of leading his own life. My work is done. He no longer needs my protection.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: But-

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: Once I've seen this war through, I'll return to his side in Isaach. Until then, Sigurd, I won't run away. For better or worse, I'm with you.

battle-talk.speaker: Lex
battle-talk.line: Geez, Azelle, you look awful! What's going on?

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: Oh, Lex... Why are you looking so happy?

battle-talk.speaker: Lex
battle-talk.line: Huh? Oh, right. My dad...

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: Mm...

battle-talk.speaker: Lex
battle-talk.line: Yeah... I'm gonna be honest, Azelle. It's not that I feel nothing at all about what happened. Can't be helped, right? But after all the pain and suffering Dad caused... Well, he deserved to go down.

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: Oh... You know, I've always admired you for your resilience, Lex. Just thinking about my brother is enough to make me tremble.

battle-talk.speaker: Lex
battle-talk.line: Yeah, Arvis has always struck me as quite an odd one, but he's always been a decent fellow. I still can't see him as our enemy...

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: I know... Arvis has always been like a father to me, and I never knew my real father. The problem is, sometimes he just... He just changes! It's as if he becomes a whole different man. That's why I...

battle-talk.speaker: Lex
battle-talk.line: That's why you up and left him behind at home, right? There's nothing wrong with that, Azelle. He's got his life, and you've got yours. Don't beat yourself up about it, okay?

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: I suppose you're right…

battle-talk.speaker: Dew
battle-talk.line: Hey... Jamke?

battle-talk.speaker: Jamke
battle-talk.line: Dew? Still here, are you? Look, didn't you hear us the first time? You're just in the way now. Go on, get outta here!

battle-talk.speaker: Dew
battle-talk.line: Ugh, why's everyone sayin' that?! What is WITH you lot lately? We're so close to winnin' this thing, but you wouldn't know it from how you're all actin'! What's goin' on here?

battle-talk.speaker: Jamke
battle-talk.line: Oh, er, sorry... You're right. I guess I am a bit tense at the moment. Not sure why, though...

battle-talk.speaker: Dew
battle-talk.line: ...Look, Jamke. You're a neat guy and I like you. I know I've kinda been a pain in the neck right from the start and... Er, sorry.

battle-talk.speaker: Jamke
battle-talk.line: Huh? Why're you so sappy all of a sudden? If anyone's being weird now, it's you!

battle-talk.speaker: Dew
battle-talk.line: Er, well, I kinda... Never mind. I guess I'll see ya later.

battle-talk.speaker: Jamke
battle-talk.line: Huh... Even Dew can tell something's not right here…

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: You holding up okay here, Arden?

battle-talk.speaker: Arden
battle-talk.line: Phew… I think the weight of this armor’s finally starting to catch up with me.

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: Hah! But I do love how manly you look in it.

battle-talk.speaker: Arden
battle-talk.line: Oh, thanks! It’s nice to hear you say that. Just as nice as how womanly you are, Ayra!

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: Womanly? Hah! Good one.

battle-talk.speaker: Arden
battle-talk.line: No, really! That’s how I see you, Ayra. You’re the loveliest lass I’ve ever known.

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: Are you sure you’re just feeling okay, Arden?

battle-talk.speaker: Arden
battle-talk.line: I can’t just not say this stuff, can I? After all, Ayra, I really do love you.

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: W-wh… Arden, you silly man…

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: I guess we're nearing the end here, Lex.

battle-talk.speaker: Lex
battle-talk.line: Yeah... Y'know, Ayra, your stubbornness never ceases to amaze. Why didn't you just leave for Isaach?

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: Why should I have? Because I'm a woman?! Why didn't you leave? You're every bit as responsible for the children as I am!

battle-talk.speaker: Lex
battle-talk.line: Yeah, you're right... Sorry about that. But I dunno... I'm still not sure we should've abandoned the kids like that.

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: That's why, the instant this war is over, we'll go back to Isaach for them. Together.

battle-talk.speaker: Lex
battle-talk.line: Fair enough. C'mon, let's get this over with!

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: Lex... I'm sorry about all that. I've always been a fighter. This is the only life I have.

battle-talk.speaker: Lex
battle-talk.line: Hah! It's fine, Ayra. I know. That's what I love about you, isn't it? I have no idea how this thing'll play out, but we're in it together, no matter what.

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: Heh... Thank you, Lex.

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: I guess we’re nearing the end here, Holyn.

battle-talk.speaker: Holyn
battle-talk.line: Mm…

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: There’s just one thing I’d like to ask you, Holyn. Is that alright?

battle-talk.speaker: Holyn
battle-talk.line: Sure. What is it?

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: You’ve always talked about wanting to protect me. What’s the reason behind that?

battle-talk.speaker: Holyn
battle-talk.line: I’ve known you since we were kids, Ayra. Nothing’s more important to me than making sure you’re safe.

battle-talk.speaker: Ayra
battle-talk.line: What?! It can’t be… Holyn, are you…

battle-talk.speaker: Holyn
battle-talk.line: The Lord of Sophara’s kid? Yeah, I am. And right from the start, Ayra, you stole my stupid little heart…

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: Hold it, Noish!

battle-talk.speaker: Noish
battle-talk.line: Lachesis?! You shouldn’t still be here! I thought we agreed you’d go to Leonster!

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: I’ve sent the children there already, but I can’t leave. I won’t leave! I’ll fight at your side till the bitter end!

battle-talk.speaker: Noish
battle-talk.line: You promised you would, Lachesis! The children need their mother to survive all of this, and they’re not even the only ones! What about Lord Eldigan’s son?

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: Ares… I don’t even know what happened to Ares after Agustria fell.

battle-talk.speaker: Noish
battle-talk.line: Lord Sigurd is gravely worried about Ares. After all, the boy lost his father at such a young age. Do you not care for Ares’ safety as well?

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: Of course I do! But… Oh, never mind. For the gods’ sakes, Noish, I am your wife! I’ll never sit back while you risk your life!

battle-talk.speaker: Noish
battle-talk.line: I know, Lachesis. I know, and I love you dearly. Never forget that.

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: Of course I won’t, dear. ...Sorry.

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: And what exactly do you think you’re still doing here, Dew?!

battle-talk.speaker: Dew
battle-talk.line: Oh, come on! I’m a lot stronger than all of ya seem to think!

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: Look, Dew I know you are. I know. The problem is, this battle is far beyond anything we’ve ever seen before. You simply won’t be able to cope, Dew.

battle-talk.speaker: Dew
battle-talk.line: Ugh, this isn’t even the first time you’ve said that all day! I’m not just a kid anymore!

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: I know, Dew. After all, I know more than most about how you’re not just a kid anymore! Heh heh!

battle-talk.speaker: Dew
battle-talk.line: Aw, look, Lachesis! You’re blushing!

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: Oh, Dew! Stop teasing!

battle-talk.speaker: Dew
battle-talk.line: Well… Guess it was nice knowin’ ya, Lachesis. Thanks for all the fun we’ve had.

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: Dew… Take care of yourself, too.

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: Beowulf...

battle-talk.speaker: Beowulf
battle-talk.line: Look, Lachesis. If somethin' happens t'me, I want ya to go to Leonster fer me. Quan's kids're there with Finn. Help 'em out where I can't, yeah?

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: No! You mustn't say such things! If I go to Leonster, you will come with me!

battle-talk.speaker: Beowulf
battle-talk.line: Lachesis... I don't think I've done right by ya.

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: W-what? Why...?

battle-talk.speaker: Beowulf
battle-talk.line: I knew how ya really felt all along...

battle-talk.speaker: Beowulf
battle-talk.line: Look after yerself, Lachesis. This was fun while it lasted.

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: Wait! Beowulf!!

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Oh, there y'are, Alec!

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: Silvia? Aw, geez! You shouldn't still be out here! Just go back to the castle! Please?

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: But I'm really worried 'bout ya, Alec...

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: Listen, Silvia. You've gotta act a bit less like a child. C'mon, you're a mother now!

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Not like you're one to talk on that one! That part's your fault too, remember?

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: Y-yeah, I guess...

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Look, Alec, you've gotta come back from this thing, okay? Without ya, I don't think Lene and me'll last... Promise? Please?

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: Silvia... Yeah, I promise. I'm coming home from this one…

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Say, Lewyn...

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Hm? What is it, Silvia?

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Do ya still like me, Lewyn?

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: What? Where'd THAT come from?!

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Well, do ya?

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Of course I still love you! That's why we're married, remember?

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Oh... 'Course. Whew. Be... Because I love you too, Lewyn... I'll never forget ya... And I don't want ya to forget me...

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Silvia…

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Hey, Claude, you doin’ okay?

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: Yes, I’m fine. But you shouldn’t still be here, Silvia. There’s nothing you can do, and you are only endangering yourself.

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: But…

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: Please, Silvia. You cannot stay with me this time.

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: But Claude… I love ya…

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: And I, you. That is why I ask…

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: No! I’m with ya ‘til death parts us!

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: Silvia, please… I can’t allow that… Please understand…

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Oh, Noish! There you are!

battle-talk.speaker: Noish
battle-talk.line: Is everything alright, Erinys?

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Yes, I'm fine.

battle-talk.speaker: Noish
battle-talk.line: That's a relief. Erinys, please... Do be careful out here. There are others depending on your health and safety now.

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: I hope the children are okay back in Silesse. The sooner we can see them again, the better.

battle-talk.speaker: Noish
battle-talk.line: Mm... For their sake, Erinys, lets see if we can finish up this fight as quickly as possible.

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Certainly! But Noish... Please, be careful as well…

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: How are you feeling, Arden?

battle-talk.speaker: Arden
battle-talk.line: I’m getting real tired of this bloody desert!

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Heh. It’s a shame you can’t ride my pegasus with me, isn’t it?

battle-talk.speaker: Arden
battle-talk.line: Mm. Maybe if I lost some of this 200-ish pounds of armor, I could.

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Say, Arden... Try not to die. Please.

battle-talk.speaker: Arden
battle-talk.line: Of course! I can’t exactly go dying now that I’ve got a lass as lovely as you to support, can I? Maybe once this war’s done, when we go back to Silesse we could quit fighting for a change and start ourselves a little shop!

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Heh… That isn’t a bad idea.

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: We've nearly reached the end, Lewyn.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Mm. But don't go forgetting that promise you made, Erinys.

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Of course. I'm to return to Silesse, no matter what happens.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Trust me, I'm not planning on dying out here. You're not going to die any time soon, either!

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Of course! I promise... Being with you... It's as if all my childhood dreams have come true! I'm not going to just die and waste that. I'll always be with you, Lewyn. Always. No matter what.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Mother's still waiting for us back in Silesse... Hell, she's probably waiting for YOU more than anything else!

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Heh... I hope that Queen Rahna... Wait, no. That Mother will be proud of me!

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Not too far to Belhalla, isn’t it, Alec?

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: Yeah. This is going to be quite the little homecoming, eh?

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: This’ll be the first time I can remember that I’m at home. What’s Jungby like?

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: It’s a lovely place. Just lovely! Heh… Plenty of lovely ladies there, too.

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Ugh… Am I going to find you in bed with another woman one day, Alec?

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: Heh, I’m kidding, I’m kidding! If I’m to die it won’t be over some other lady!

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Good. You’re not gonna do me much good if you’re dead, are you? After all, we’ve still got to finish up here first! And I guess I can’t just let you die if it means the kids won’t have a dad….

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: Don’t worry! Luck’s on my side, just like always. How else do you explain me getting married to someone like you?

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Oh, Alec…

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: You holding up okay, Midir?

battle-talk.speaker: Midir
battle-talk.line: Mm, I’m fine. And how about you?

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Yeah. I’m okay. I know I’ll be okay if I’m right here with you.

battle-talk.speaker: Midir
battle-talk.line: I’m so glad we met, Brigid, and I’ll always be grateful for our time together.

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Excuse me? This had better not be some clumsy attempt to end this marriage, Midir!

battle-talk.speaker: Midir
battle-talk.line: Er, sorry about that. I just wanted to make sure you knew…

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Midir, listen. I know about how you mooned after Aideen all those years. You sure you’re happy with just me.

battle-talk.speaker: Midir
battle-talk.line: Of course! Yes, I liked Lady Aideen… But it was never real love. You’re the only one I’ve ever really loved!

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Thanks, Midir… I’m here for you until the end…

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: You holding up okay, Jamke? Bet you're getting tired.

battle-talk.speaker: Jamke
battle-talk.line: Yeah, I'm doing fine. And you?

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Yeah, 'cause I've got you at my side...

battle-talk.speaker: Jamke
battle-talk.line: Are you sure I can't persuade you to escape, Brigid? I'm still not comfortable with you fighting in this mess of a battle.

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Oh, yeah. Dead sure, Jamke. Do you really still have to ask? You'd think I'd have made my point by now.

battle-talk.speaker: Jamke
battle-talk.line: Right...

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Jamke... You sure you're happy with me?

battle-talk.speaker: Jamke
battle-talk.line: Hm?

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: Are you happy with me? I sorta know what you were like about Aideen...

battle-talk.speaker: Jamke
battle-talk.line: Oh, come on. This again? You're the one I love, Brigid. You're the one I want to spend the rest of my life with.

battle-talk.speaker: Brigid
battle-talk.line: S-sorry about that... Still glad I asked, though…

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: Don’t go, Azelle!

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: Tailtiu, you promised you would be headed for Silesse by now! I swear I’ll follow you as soon as I possibly can.

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: But…

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: You cannot fight the Freege army! Do you really plan on attempting to kill your own father, Tailtiu?

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: Er… No, I don’t think I can…

battle-talk.speaker: Azelle
battle-talk.line: Good. I don’t think I could stomach the idea of you, or anyone else, being willing to kill their father. Look after the children for me, Tailtiu.

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: Azelle? Azelle!!

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: You’ve still gotta fight, don’t you, Lex?

battle-talk.speaker: Lex
battle-talk.line: Yeah, I do. Tailtiu, just go ahead to Silesse already. I know you’ll be safe there.

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: How can you be so cruel, leaving me alone?

battle-talk.speaker: Lex
battle-talk.line: Look, all of House Freege is out here doing their damnedest to take you back, whether you want to or not. And I don’t think I could live with myself if you or the kids were taken by them or the Dozels. You’ve gotta understand!

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: But…

battle-talk.speaker: Lex
battle-talk.line: Look, right from the start, fate seriously screwed us both over. I wish we’d had longer together, but what little time we did have’ll always mean so much to me, right till the end.

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: Oh, Lex…

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: Claude, what do you think I should do?

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: Fighting the Freege army is out of the question. I don't believe engaging your own father in battle is at all advisable. Please, go to Silesse. There is still a safe, peaceful life awaiting you there.

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: But what about you, Claude?

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: I have an obligation, Tailtiu. My fate is to stay here and see this war through till its very end.

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: How can you be so cruel? Wh... What about our children?!

battle-talk.speaker: Claude
battle-talk.line: I understand how difficult this fate will be for you, but please... Please understand.

battle-talk.speaker: Tailtiu
battle-talk.line: Claude!!

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: Well, Noish, I suppose this is it.

battle-talk.speaker: Noish
battle-talk.line: Mm…

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: Thanks for everything.

battle-talk.speaker: Noish
battle-talk.line: You, too…

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: It’s been quite an adventure, huh?

battle-talk.speaker: Noish
battle-talk.line: That it has.

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: Take care of yourself, alright?

battle-talk.speaker: Noish
battle-talk.line: And you as well…

character-falls.speaker: Byron
character-falls.line: Gah... Is this as far as I'll go?

character-falls.speaker: Ethlyn
character-falls.line: Hold tight, Altena! I'll protect you no matter what!

character-falls.speaker: Ethlyn
character-falls.line: Ahh! Altena... Quan... I'm so sorry…

character-falls.speaker: Quan
character-falls.line: Away, Thracian beasts! So long as I hold Gáe Bolg, only one of us will live this day!

character-falls.speaker: Quan
character-falls.line: Blast! Can I go no further...?

character-falls.speaker: Quan
character-falls.line: Oh, Ethlyn... Forgive me... Finn... I entrust Leif... to you…

boss.speaker: Vaha
boss.line: Take this! Feel the fiery wrath of the heavens!

boss.speaker: Vaha
boss.line: Urgh... Oh, Lord Arvis... Forgive my failure…

boss.speaker: Reptor
boss.line: Hm hm hm... It's time you had a lesson in obedience. Your teacher will be the supreme thunder magic Mjölnir!

boss.speaker: Reptor
boss.line: Die! If I'm to burn, you will ALL burn with me!

boss.speaker: Reptor
boss.line: Guhhh... Arvis... What in the blazes are you... scheming?

boss.speaker: Reptor
boss.line: Pah! Don't make me laugh, you naïve twit! Consider this a lesson in politics and power! Your father had no power, and hence he is dead! Even a common knight such as yourself can surely appreciate this fundamental truth!

boss.speaker: Sigurd
boss.line: A knight appreciates honor and justice. I see neither of those in your actions! For too long you've soiled Grannvale's honor. I've come to set the fatherland to rights!

boss.speaker: Reptor
boss.line: Such a pity your hard work is all for naught! Byron died a sad, pitiful traitor, and you will meet his very same fate at my hands! In the face of the supreme power of thunder, Mjölnir, you are but a candle to be snuffed! Sigurd, your dying thought will lament your complete and utter lack of power Ahahaha…

boss.speaker: Reptor
boss.line: T-Tailtiu... I can hardly believe it... No matter how traitorous you became... Not once did I expect to face you like this.

boss.speaker: Reptor
boss.line: Curse that Claude! How dare he fill my daughter's head with lies... No, it's too late. I have no choice... I must protect the honor of House Freege. Tailtiu, for your treachery, you must die.

boss.speaker: Reptor
boss.line: Aida... How dare you! You treacherous wretch...

boss.speaker: Aida
boss.line: Hah! You're as sore a loser as I expected, Reptor. You'd do well to surrender now.
